required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Sleep to Activate Mood Promotion- Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are aiming to examine the acceptability and feasibility of a portable bright light therapy instrument to improve sleep disturbance in a preventive intervention for depression. The investigators will conduct an intervention that trials the use of bright light glasses called "re-timers" as a preventive intervention in older adults with sleep disturbance and subsyndromal symptoms of depression.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after introduction of intervention
primary_outcome.description: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index is a validated scale which measures self-reported sleep quality based on a wide variety of questions (duration, quality, disturbances, medication, etc.) and converts them to a scale which ranges from 0 to 21 where 6 or higher denotes poor sleep quality.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after introduction of intervention
primary_outcome.description: The PHQ-9 Depression Scale is a validated scale ranging from 0 to 27 with higher numbers representing greater severity of depressive symptoms, based on 9 questions with each question on a scale of 0 - 3.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after introduction of intervention
primary_outcome.description: The Insomnia Severity Index measures insomnia severity on a scale from 0 to 28. A score of 15 or higher is indicative of clinical insomnia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after introduction of intervention
primary_outcome.description: The morningness- eveningness categories represent the time of day when a person is at their peak alertness.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: mean nightly sleep duration for each of the two-week periods: baseline and intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: Actigraphy counts awakenings by using an accelerometer to assess motion during the night. The number of awakenings is the mean nightly number of awakenings during each of the two-week periods: baseline and intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep efficiency is calculated as a percentage reflecting the amount of time in bed spent asleep (time asleep/time in bed x 100). The mean for each of the two-week periods: baseline and intervention, is calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: mean nightly sleep duration in minutes for each of the two-week periods: baseline and intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: mean nightly awakenings for each of the two week periods: baseline and intervention. Similar to the actigraph the Fitbit counts awakenings through an accelerometer which measures motion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep efficiency is calculated as a percentage reflecting the amount of time in bed spent asleep (time asleep/time in bed x 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Sleep Diary: Time at Which Participants go to Bed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period to be compared
secondary_outcome.description: Bed time represents the moment in time at which participants went to bed, measured on a revised clock where 6pm = 18, Midnight = 24 and 6am =30. Time between actual hours is calculated on a decimal basis, so an additional 6 minutes = .1. This revised clock is necessary in order to make means work properly in the nighttime hours. Otherwise, averaging between a 10pm bedtime and a 2am bedtime would give the impossible, inaccurate mean of being in the daytime between those two numbers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Sleep Diary: Time at Which Participants Wake up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period to be compared
secondary_outcome.description: Wake time represents the moment in time at which participants awaken. Time between actual hours is calculated on a decimal basis so an additional 6 minutes = .1. so that 7.5 represents 7:30 a.m. and 7.8 represents 7:48 a.m.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period to be compared
secondary_outcome.description: sleep quality is a participants' mean self-report for each of the two week periods: baseline and intervention. Sleep quality is reported for each night on a scale of 0 (very poor) to 4 (very good).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period to be compared
secondary_outcome.description: mean number of night awakenings per person per night as reported in sleep diaries

secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily for 4 weeks- baseline and intervention period to be compared
secondary_outcome.description: nightly mean of length of sleep measured in minutes

arm_group.description: Before the bright light intervention is initiated (and during the intervention), participants will wear two wrist bands which measure sleep quality and activity levels- the Fitbit and actigraphy watches. These will be worn for two weeks to assess individuals' baseline levels of sleep quality and will continue to be worn during the intervention. Following the baseline period, the re-timer glasses will be introduced and worn for a period of 30 to 50 minutes a day for two weeks.

intervention.description: Participants will wear the Re-timer glasses for 30 minutes a day according to their sleep chronotype in weeks 3 and 4 of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 years of age or older
- 6 or greater on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
- A score of 5 to 9 on the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 Depression Scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active suicidal ideation
- Presence of mania or bipolar disorder
- Presence of an eye disease
- Prescription of a photosensitizing medication
- Having previously had eye surgery

group.title: Bright Light Intervention
group.description: Before the bright light intervention is initiated (and during the intervention), participants will wear two wrist bands which measure sleep quality and activity levels- the Fitbit and actigraphy watches. These will be worn for two weeks to assess individuals’ baseline levels of sleep quality and will continue to be worn during the intervention. Following the baseline period, the re-timer glasses will be introduced and worn for a period of 30 to 50 minutes a day for two weeks. Re-Timer glasses: Participants will wear the Re-timer glasses for 30 minutes a day according to their sleep chronotype in weeks 3 and 4 of the study.

baseline.population: Baseline measures are given for the study sample that completed study procedures.

group.title: Bright Light Intervention
group.description: Before the bright light intervention is initiated (and during the intervention), participants will wear two wrist bands which measure sleep quality and activity levels- the Fitbit and actigraphy watches. These will be worn for two weeks to assess individuals’ baseline levels of sleep quality and will continue to be worn during the intervention. Following the baseline period, the re-timer glasses will be introduced and worn for a period of 30 to 50 minutes a day for two weeks. Re-Timer glasses: Participants will wear the Re-timer glasses for 30 minutes a day according to their sleep chronotype in weeks 3 and 4 of the study.

measure.title: Patient Health Questionnaire-9
measure.description: The PHQ-9 Depression Scale is a validated scale ranging from 0 to 27 with higher numbers representing greater severity of depressive symptoms, based on 9 questions with each question on a scale of 0 - 3.

class.title: After 2 wks sleep tracking/prior to intervention

measure.title: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
measure.description: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index is a validated scale which measures self-reported sleep quality based on a wide variety of questions (duration, quality, disturbances, medication, etc.) and converts them to a scale which ranges from 0 to 21 where 6 or higher denotes poor sleep quality.

class.title: After 2 wks sleep tracking/prior to intervention

measure.title: Insomnia Severity Index
measure.description: The Insomnia Severity Index measures insomnia severity on a scale from 0 to 28. A score of 15 or higher is indicative of clinical insomnia. Data for all 11 participants is provided at two baseline time points: prior to wearing a monitor at all, and after two weeks of wearing a monitoring device, prior to use of ReTimer glasses

class.title: After 2 wks sleep tracking/prior to intervention 3

outcome.description: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index is a validated scale which measures self-reported sleep quality based on a wide variety of questions (duration, quality, disturbances, medication, etc.) and converts them to a scale which ranges from 0 to 21 where 6 or higher denotes poor sleep quality.
outcome.time_frame: two weeks after introduction of intervention

These will be worn for two weeks to assess individuals’ baseline levels of sleep quality and will continue to be worn during the intervention. Following the baseline period, the re-timer glasses will be introduced and worn for a period of 30 to 50 minutes a day for two weeks. measure.title: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
measure.description: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index is a validated scale which measures self-reported sleep quality based on a wide variety of questions (duration, quality, disturbances, medication, etc.) and converts them to a scale which ranges from 0 to 21 where 6 or higher denotes poor sleep quality.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis, like the measures themselves, tracks the significance of the change from end of pre-intervention period to end of intervention period, so while only a single comparison group is listed, because it is all one population group, there are two sets of data for that group.
analysis.p_value_desc: This t-test analyzes the change in mean between the midpoint interview immediately prior to the start of the intervention and the follow-up interview at the conclusion of the intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
